Seagate Case Study

SRS Data Recovery

When you find your drive broken and need to recover important data, you don’t want a big hassle. You just want it done. Yet, when moving through Seagate’s old data recovery form you had to overcome road block after road block.

Asked to improve the entire experience, this is how we did it start to finish.

  1. Research We learned about the ins and outs of the pre-existing Seagate form, then conducted a competitive analysis of the online data recovery experience.
  2. User Journey Using previous analytics, personas and constructing a funnel of how user's would arrive on the form, we gained insight into the user journey.
  3. Wireframe Our wireframes set the stage for the final discovery lap with the client. After several revisions we were ready to craft a design specification for user interactions.
  4. HTML & CSS Next, we built the replacement form. We now had responsive webpages that could be filled out comfortably on a smartphone or a 55" TV.
  5. Integration Using APEX, our developers built the form within Seagate's Salesforce instance. This created a user account & generated a new case in the CRM for internal tracking.
  6. eCommerce Once cases were created we modified our form to process payments via CyberSource, a payment processing gateway.
  7. Shipping After the payment was approved, we made the form pull a pre-paid shipping label with the correct locale by connecting to the UPS API.
  8. Nuturing After a case is submitted, the user's information is pushed from CRM to a Marketing Automation platform. There, our MA experts setup email campaigns to send updates to the user about their case.

Client Challenge

Users had to fill out a 5 page form. During which they had to create a login and remember it to get up-to-date progress on their drives' recovery. If they forgot that login, they had to call in for an update.

Final payment was done over the phone. Each new recovery case averaged 14 phone calls from Seagate service representatives. This was a strenuous process that required a lot of personnel to support.

Solution

Seagate SRS came to Iron-Point to turn this nightmare into a user experience dream. We worked with people around the global to implement a highly dynamic Salesforce integrated form.

Our new form was a single page for submission, payment, and UPS label generation. The process takes less than 60 seconds to complete.

In addition to that slick process, we also created a spew of Eloqua automated - multi-lingual - emails that notify users of where their hard drives is at in the recovery process.

Our previous online customer interaction was a painful process because it was lengthy and had many redundant requirements. As a result, we had a significant abandonment rate.

The IP team helped us automate and streamline the process.

Thanks to them, we have substantially increased our submission rate while decreasing the abandonment rate.

All of these actions really helped us support our objective for a premium customer experience.

Jackie Iverson

Seagate Recovery Services

Fluke Case Study

Thermal Imager Firmware Updates

Everyone wants to be able to download important firmware updates to their devices. It’s frustrating when you can't find the right one and outrageous when you never get notified about an important firmware update.

Fluke's Thermal Imaging Department didn't have a firmware update process. Shoot, their products never required one in the past.

But something new was on the horizon. Fluke developed a firmware update to give their customers a chance to utilize the built-in wi-fi receiver on their device.

With firmware updates at the ready, Fluke was prepared to give their customers a simple way to make the change. It was a task easier said than done.

Upgrading a device in use around the world, and used for potentially nefarious activities, made for a complex situation made even more so with multiple products requiring different firmware updates, various countries embargoed, and some countries still pending legal agreement. Whew. And it all had to be communicated in 19 different languages to some 36 countries.

We helped Fluke achieve their goals with:

  • Eloqua – Marketing Automation. Firmware software is extensive, expensive, and requires high up-keep. We helped Fluke identify a solution using their existing Eloqua system, saving thousands.
  • Dynamic Landing Page. We developed a form that integrated with Fluke's existing desktop syncing software. We used this to grab vital firmware information that we used to process the firmware update and to predict the user's preferred language.
  • A dynamic thank you page which gave the unique code the customer needed to download the firmware update.
  • Responsive(mobile friendly), multi-lingual, email campaigns to alert the customer when the firmware update was available in their country.
  • A country approval portal built with Eloqua's API that enabled our client to easily add newly approved countries.

Ready to take your marketing automation around the world?

Fusion-io Case Study

Global SQL Roadshow

Has your sales team ever planned an event and then completely failed to tell you about it?

Fusion-io's marketing team came to us hoping to quickly put together a massive project — design, forms, landing pages, emails, and marketing automation — for a global roadshow in 30 different cities.

The roadshow was planned from mid-April thru the end of October. There were challenges everywhere: multiple languages, alternative events per city, and the need for consistent marketing.

Oh, and there was a catch — we had two weeks to get ready.

Optimizing Pardot, we hit the deadline and delivered:

  • A dynamic, responsive form and thank you page that supported multiple languages.
  • Custom JavaScript that powered sending all 30 city event requests through a single Pardot form.
  • A Multitude of drip campaigns that used responsive email templates to invite potential attendees.
  • Lists and automation rules were used in conjunction with SFDC campaigns to keep sales moving with correct campaign and reporting.
Want fresh ideas? Find out when we post a new case study.
